title: Oil Prices Approach $100 on Threat of Ukraine War
sub_head: Natural-gas prices surge in Europe after Germany halts Nord Stream 2 pipeline; aluminum, nickel and wheat rise
body:
Oil, natural gas and agricultural prices rose as escalating tensions over the future of Ukraine threatened to disrupt flows of natural resources from Eastern Europe to world markets.
Futures for Brent crude, the benchmark in international energy markets, added 2.3% to reach $97.62 a barrel and earlier climbed to $99.50 a barrel, their highest level since 2014. In Europe, natural-gas prices rose 11% to â‚¬80.58 ($91.40) a megawatt-hour after Germany halted the Nord Stream 2 pipeline in response to Russian aggression against Ukraine.
